title: There Is Plastic In The Clouds
content:
Understanding the real scale and scope and consequences of the
environmental crisis depends on how digital technology influences our thinking
about it in terms of scale and depth and short and long term consequences, as
well as what solutions we can imagine to create and deploy against all this
chaos. Text by Marek Tuszynski
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: See what’s new at the Influence Industry Project!
content: Discover the latest research, resources and training materials created together with researchers, journalists, and civil society to raise awareness and promote conversations about how political groups engage with technology and work with private firms to influence voters' opinions and decisions.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title:
An Assessment of the Needs of Educators and Youth in Europe for a Digital
and Media Literacy Education Intervention
content: Using an interdisciplinary approach that combines educator scoping sessions, research, literature review and youth input sessions, Tactical Tech identified insights and recommendations about topics, formats and facilitation methodologies crucial to creating effective Digital and Media Literacy Educational resources.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: We are turning 20
content:
Twenty years ago, Tactical Tech was formed with the goal of
enabling communities around the world to face the challenges and changes
brought by new digital technologies. This year, we celebrate two decades of
innovation and co-creation with our partners, collaborators and funders.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Digital and Media Literacy Education: Navigating an Ever-Evolving Landscape
content: This commissioned research report includes the main findings and recommendations regarding the latest developments in the Digital and Media Literacy Education field.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Annual Report 2022
content:
In 2022, Tactical Tech partnered with over 150 trusted local actors
from more than 60 countries to inform and engage their communities in
conversations around the relationship between technology, democracy and crises
and to provide them with the necessary tools and information to enable them to
take action and make informed decisions. Discover the results and impact of
our collaborative work in 2022.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Adventures in Mapping Digital Empires
content:
For years, Tactical Tech has worked to understand and visualise Big
Tech's impact on society. In this piece, you will be taken on a journey
through the different formats, narratives and visual representations Tactical
Tech has used to tell the story behind the acquisitions, mergers and
investments of the Big Tech Google, Amazon, Facebook, Apple and Microsoft.
Read to learn about our provocation design approach to promote digital
thinking.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title:
Our digital and media literacy resources for youth are now available in
15 languages
content:
Our What The Future Wants exhibition and digital and media literacy
resources for young people are now available in 15 different languages. To
date, the What the Future Wants events have engaged more than 11.500
participants in 30  countries.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title:
Cycles of Control: Private Companies and the Surveillance of
Reproductive Health
content:
Data about reproduction, and especially menstruation, is being
tracked and gathered by many different companies, without people’s awareness
of the extent or the financial value this data has, nor the possible
consequences for them individually or the collective harm.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: The GAFAM Empire project
content:
GAFAM Empire is a project developed by DensityDesign Lab and
Tactical Tech that looks at all the known acquisitions conducted by five big
tech companies: Google, Amazon, Facebook, Apple, and Microsoft, from the
moment they made their first one to the end of summer of 2022, when we stopped
collecting data.

title:
Co-Creation as Methodology for Uncertain Times: Practice, Learnings, and
Findings
content:
In this mini-series, we explore how Tactical Tech’s first
youth-centered team co-created the public education intervention What the
Future Wants, which was released in Spring 2022. Here we dive into the
workshops we conducted and share principles and practices that informed the
co-creation process and findings from the workshops.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Co-Creating a Public Education Intervention: A Contextual Analysis
content:
This series outlines the initiation, delivery, and findings of the
What the Future Wants project (so far) in the hope that other organisations,
initiatives, and individuals working with young people can learn from our
experience and the rich insights of all of the young people who contributed.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

Sub-Saharan Africa
content: The Digital You initiative is a collaboration between Goethe-Institut Kinshasa and Tactical Tech, that invites young people in Sub-Saharan African countries to think critically about their relationship with digital technologies and how tech influences their lives.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title:
The Influence Industry Explorer: A new online tool to explore 500
companies enabling political influence worldwide
content: Tactical Tech launches “The Influence Industry Explorer”, an online investigation tool that comprises evidence on 500 companies that work with political groups in over 30 countries to influence voters’ opinions.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title:
New Report: Digital Reset. Redirecting Technologies for the Deep
Sustainability Transformation.
content:
The “Digital Reset” report by the project ‘Digitalization for
Sustainability – Science in Dialogue’ (D4S) shows how digital technologies can
support the quest for such a deep sustainability transformation. The report
provides a blueprint for the European Union to reconceptualise digitalisation
so that it first and foremost contributes to achieving carbon neutrality,
resource autonomy and economic resilience while supporting equity and fully
respecting citizens’ rights and privacy.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Digital Enquirer Kit: 2022 Summer Training Series
content:
Through the nine sessions of the Digital Security Training
Program, experts, who co-wrote the course, will provide you with
skills,  tools and best practices in the field. The Digital Enquirer Kit is an
e-learning course that guides learners on how to prevent the spread of
misinformation, available on digitalenquirer.org and atingi.org. The course
covers topics including media literacy, verification, and how to navigate the
internet safely.

title: Unboxing Tech Toolkit

technology can tune our behavior, emotions and attention, and importantly,

title: Data at First Sight: Telling the human story through numbers
content:
Good stories are relatable: they speak to the reader. Stories that
have data at the centre are no different. Find out how to make numbers
resonate with the reader in this new article from our Exposing the Invisible
project!
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Call for Internship: Project Assistant
content:
Tactical Tech is offering an internship position for a student or a
junior professional to assist The Glass Room project in preparing materials
and supporting partners globally in organising events for their communities.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Time for Big Tech to Grow Up
content:
Our Executive Director and co-founder Stephanie Hankey responds to
Facebook whistleblower Frances Haugen's testimony and argues that, when it
comes to social media and young people: "it's Big Tech that needs to grow
up".
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Investigative Initiatives in the Americas – Meet the “New Digitals”
content:
The digital media sphere is thriving in the Spanish- and
Portuguese-speaking Americas. Crucially, many “new digitals” are collaborating
with each other - find out more with this list of initiatives from our
Exposing the Invisible project.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: No Disaster Is Natural: Investigating climate change
content:
Climate disasters are often described as 'natural' phenomena, only
remotely fuelled by carbon emissions. This article from Exposing the Invisible
explores pathways for investigating climate disasters and how - or whether -
communities can adapt to them.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Project Coordinator: 'Online Influence and Opinion'
content:
We are looking for a highly committed and experienced Project
Coordinator for a group of projects under the key theme 'Online Influence and
Opinion'. Read more and apply by October 5th!
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: The Glass Room - Netherlands
content:
From the tech boom to tech backlash, our understanding of the
digital has become both deeply personal and deeply political. Two major Glass
Room exhibitions tackling these themes are taking place in The Netherlands, in
Leeuwarden and Amsterdam.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title:
Detox de Datos Latinx — Campaigning with Characters in Latin America &
the Caribbean
content:
Detox de Datos Latinx is a social media campaign and project for
young people in Latin America and the Caribbean to educate their peers about
data and technology, based on our Data Detox x Youth.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title:
'Technologies of Hope & Fear' recognised with a Prix Ars Electronica
Honorary Mention
content:
The 'Technologies of Hope & Fear' project received an Honorary
Mention in the frame of the Prix Ars Electronica. This interactive research
looks at a curated selection of 100 technologies developed in response to the
global COVID-19 pandemic.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: ‘Investigation is Collaboration’ Online Conference
content:
Our Exposing the Invisible project is hosting an online conference
from 2nd-6th August to celebrate the people, initiatives & techniques that
make investigation accessible. Attendance is free - register by 31st July!
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: The Complete Organiser's Activity Book
content:
Over the past year, our Data & Activism project has released five
chapters full of playful exercises for civil society organisers, which have
now been combined into the complete Organiser's Activity Book.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: How to Create a Data Policy
content:
Working with data comes with risks. This four-step guide from our
Data & Activism project is designed to help individuals, NGOs and other civil
society actors create their own Data Policy.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Investigation is Collaboration: How to Make It Work
content:
Never investigate alone. Collaboration is essential to your
safety, well-being and effectiveness as an investigator, no matter the
context. This guide from Exposing the Invisible: The Kit will help you plan,
organise and run your collaboration with investigators, sources and others.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Get Your Facts Straight: The Basics of Fact-Checking
content:
You can’t trust everything you read, see or hear. Learn from a
practitioner what it means to fact-check every piece of information you find
and intend to use in this latest chapter of Exposing the Invisible: The Kit.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Annual Report 2020
content:
In our Annual Report 2020, you can read about our activities and
successes across each of our projects last year, as well as who we are as an
organisation and how we responded to the COVID-19 pandemic.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: [CLOSED] Call for a Podcast Producer
content:
Our Exposing the Invisible project is looking for a short-term
podcast producer to help create a series of brief, inspiring and informative
podcasts.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: The National Resistance Movement App and Digital Politics in Uganda
content:
The final part of our Data & Politics series on Medium looks at
campaign apps around the 2021 election in Uganda, in cooperation with The App
Analyst.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Campaign Apps Ghana 2020
content:
How was a mobile phone shop in Vietnam able to access personal data
from voters in Ghana? The third part of our Data & Politics series on Medium
looks at campaign apps in the 2020 Ghanaian election.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: The Glass Room: Capsule 1.0
content:
The Glass Room presents Capsule 1.0, a quarterly showcase of
digital objects - old and new - from previous Community Edition series,
independent investigations and collaborations. This first capsule explores how
our phone numbers, face prints and personal data travel from our smartphones
to different third-party organisations.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Why Civil Society Organisers Need a Data Policy
content:
Civil society organisers rely on personal data and data-driven
tactics to support individuals and groups. Find out about the importance of a
data policy in this latest article from our Data & Activism project.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Why Investigate Election Apps?
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: The Influence Industry Long List: The Business of Your Data and Your Vote
content:
Our Data and Politics project has released an updated version of
The Influence Industry Long List, with 500 companies working with personal
data to support political campaigns, from digital campaign consultants to data
brokers.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: OSINT – Diving into an ‘Ocean’ of Information
content: A new chapter of Exposing the Invisible: The Kit looks at how combining different openly available information sources can lead to meaningful results in your investigation, using what is known as open source intelligence.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Data Acquisition for Beginners
content: Finding and gathering information is essential to any investigation, but not all data sets are created equal. This new chapter of Exposing the Invisible: The Kit includes descriptions of common file types, methods for gathering data, and a how-to guide on converting your data into a format more easily analysed by computer programs.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Consultancy Call: Researcher/Writer on Digital Investigation Techniques
content: We are looking for experienced Researchers/Writers with a strong understanding of digital investigative techniques, to help create written learning materials to train journalists, human rights defenders, and civil society on leading investigations, particularly in Latin America, Sub-Saharan Africa, MENA, and Southeast Asia.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: [Application Extension: 6th April] What the Future Wants: Call for Partners
content:
Tactical Tech is seeking partners to work with us to deliver a new
project that explores the topics of European youth, technology, culture and
critical thinking based on our award-winning project The Glass Room.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Lessons To Learn: Young People And AI
content: What do young people need to know about artificial intelligence (AI) in order to use it responsibly and make informed decisions? Our co-founder Stephanie Hankey spoke to the Goethe-Institut about the need for educational institutions and civil society to join forces to promote digital literacy.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Personal Data and the Influence Industry in Nigerian Elections
content: We are excited to announce the launch of our new report 'Personal Data and the Influence Industry in Nigerian Elections' in partnership with CDD West Africa, which highlights techniques and technologies used by political actors in recent campaigns in Nigeria.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: [Application Extension: 28th March] 'Exposing the Invisible' Institute
content: Join us for a free four-week online Investigative Training Institute from 4th - 31st May 2021! You will learn from and collaborate with civil society investigators across the European Union to develop skills and techniques for secure investigations and digital research. Applications close 28th March.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Online Events and Personal Data
content: In this chapter of the Organiser's Activity Book, discover what types of personal data are created during online events. Learn about the tools that are available to host online events; the differences in how they work; and their risks and benefits.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Transparency in Data-Driven Campaigns
content: Tactical Tech’s Data & Politics Team is excited to announce that the Swedish Postcode Foundation will support our latest initiative to create transparency on the use of personal data in political campaigns and the surrounding influence industry.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Refresh and Renew
content: When you Google your name, you'll likely find a whole range of digital traces: do you want the world to find everything you've ever put online? A new Data Detox Kit article explains how to curate your online identity and accounts.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: A Data-Day
content:
Check out this updated visualisation of the data you give away when
you click 'I Agree', with key phrases from the terms and conditions of popular
apps and services.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Elections — There’s An App for That
content: Our Data & Politics team has teamed up with The App Analyst to explore the personal data collected by election campaign apps. Read more on Medium - or nominate an app for analysis!
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: How many trees does it take to power the internet?
content: You may already know that airplanes, fast fashion and factory farming are harmful to the environment, but have you ever considered the carbon footprint of watching videos or sending emails? Find out more in a new chapter of the Data Detox Kit!
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Now Translated - Personal Data: Personal Persuasion
content: Together with partners from across the globe, Data & Politics' flagship report and guide 'Personal Data: Political Persuasion. Inside the Influence Industry' is now available in Arabic, Hausa, Khmer, Russian, Spanish and Ukrainian.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Reflections on the European Democracy Action Plan
content: If Europe’s elections are to remain contests of campaigns’ political ideas and not of their digital strategies, the systemic challenges to democracy must not be overlooked by the fires of the present moment. Varoon Bashyakarla from our Data & Politics team writes for the Heinrich-Böll-Stiftung.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Data & Politics: Global Partnerships
content: In order to investigate the 'Influence Industry' in different contexts and countries, our Data & Politics project has partnered with a diverse range of organisations and individuals in the Global South. Find out more about the work these partners do.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Evaluating Evidence and Information Sources
content: You’ve identified and collected information that may serve as evidence in your investigation. What next? Learn how to analyse and verify it as well as how to evaluate your information sources in this new chapter from Exposing the Invisible: The Kit.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Skin Deep: Deep Fakes and Misinformation
content: Misinformation and disinformation have dominated headlines in 2020 and eroded trust in the information that surrounds us, from social media to conventional media; from politicians to scientists; from text to photographs to videos. Reality, it seems, is increasingly only skin deep. Find out more in this article on Medium.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Bio-Investigations in the Field
content: A new chapter from Exposing the Invisible: The Kit explores 'bio-investigations', including the collection and analysis of samples from the field, at home and in the your local community.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Data Detox Workshops
content: The Data Detox Kit Workshops page is now live! Here you'll find downloadable curriculum materials which have been developed and tested by Tactical Tech trainers and Data Detox Kit's global network of partners.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Misinformation Edition: Translations
content: The Glass Room: Misinformation Edition, which can be visited online or hosted offline, has been translated into French, German, Spanish, Italian, Swedish, Slovenian, Lithuanian and Ukrainian, with more coming soon. Take a look and visit the exhibition virtually in your preferred language!
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Investigative Institute: Deadline Extended
content: The deadline for applications to our 'Exposing the Invisible' Investigative Institute from January-February 2021 has been extended to 11th December. Join us for a three-week online workshop to share skills and techniques for secure investigations and digital research methods across the European Union.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: A Voter's Guide: 7 Tips to Detox Your Data
content: Our Voter’s Guide explains how personal data is collected and used by political parties and candidates – and what voters can do about it. The seven tips are now available in both English and Dutch.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Your Data, Our Democracy
content:
As elections become increasingly data-intensive, our personal data
is becoming a political asset for campaigns to leverage. This new animation,
in English and Dutch, explains how this process happens - and what we can do
about it.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Understanding Misinformation: Our Society, Our Technology, Ourselves
content: The internet has become the perfect breeding ground and circulatory system for all kinds of untrue or inaccurate claims. Our Programme Director, Christy Lange, asks what citizens and technology users can do in the face of misinformation in an article for the Heinrich-Böll-Stiftung.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Predictive Futures
content: This summer, tens of thousands of British school students took to the streets to protest the use of an algorithm that predicted their end-of-school grades. A new article on Medium from the coordinator of our Youth project, Daisy Kidd, looks at the normalisation of monitoring and surveillance in education.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Exposing the Invisible Awarded European Commission Grant
content:
Our Exposing the Invisible team was awarded a European Commission grant to organise workshops, develop
resources and create an ‘Investigative Institute’ for journalists, civil society investigators and researchers from September 2020 to August 2021.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Event Promotion for Organisers
content: This new chapter of the Organiser's Activity Book from our Data & Activism project looks at event promotion. The playful activities, aimed at organisers, campaigners and human rights defenders, explore the consequences, risks and benefits of using tools like social media in terms of personal data.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: The 'Influence Industry' In Sub-Saharan Africa
content: A new report, based on a roundtable with regional experts, looks at how the 'Influence Industry' operates in Sub-Saharan Africa. Read a summary on Medium by Amber Macintyre from our Data & Politics team.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: The Zoom Boom: Tools To Work from Home
content: Due to the pandemic and resulting quarantine, millions of people are using digital tools to continue their work and communication from home. A new article for the Heinrich-Böll-Stiftung by our Programme Director, Christy Lange, asks: how secure are the digital tools that have become a part of our everyday life?
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Gathering Visual Evidence
content: Learn how to identify, record and represent the images of an event by mastering the basics of visual evidence collection in this new chapter from Exposing the Invisible: The Kit.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Safety First!
content: Stay digitally, physically and psychologically safe and aware of potential risks by adopting some basic good practices and tools to keep your human sources, yourself and your evidence protected in this new chapter of Exposing the Invisible: The Kit.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Travel and Our Data Baggage
content: What data traces do we leave when we travel? A new chapter of the playful, interactive Organiser's Activity Book helps civil society organisers deal with 'data baggage', including flights, visas and accommodation.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Hacked Off: The Data Detox Kit
content: This guest post for the Hacked Off campaign outlines our Data Detox Kit, and how it can help you with your digital security, privacy and wellbeing, as well as countering online misinformation.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: The Behavioural Surveillance Dilemma
content: Governments and tech companies are working together to establish bio and behavioural surveillance infrastructures in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic. Stephanie Hankey asks whether this will be a positive leap forward or a move in the wrong direction, in a new article for the Heinrich-Böll-Stiftung.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: A Fistful of Privacy Tips: Tech at Protests
content: Whether you’re expressing your disapproval on the web or on the streets, technology will play a role in how you protest. This Data Detox guide will help activists and protesters stay vigilant when using smartphones, social media, and messaging apps.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: The Glass Room: Misinformation Edition
content: The Glass Room: Misinformation Edition explores how social media and the web have changed the way we read information and react to it. This new exhibition, which can be visited online or hosted offline, tackles all forms of misinformation.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Filter Bubbles: Hide and Seek On Your Feed
content: Social media platforms can bring us closer - but they also use algorithms to separate us. Find out how 'filter bubbles' are created, and how you can burst yours, in this article from the Data Detox Kit.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Beyond Screens: Managing the Screen Time Dilemma
content: How much screen time is too much for children of different ages? This article from the Data Detox Kit provides essential advice for parents as part of the new 'Youth and Families' section.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: What the Future Wants
content: A new article on Medium by Stephanie Hankey, our Executive Director, and Daisy Kidd, coordinator of our upcoming Youth project, considers how digital technologies are designed for young people and asks the question: What does the future want?
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Personal Data in Dutch Politics: Country Study
content: The latest of over a dozen country studies from our Data & Politics team, carried out in collaboration with partners around the world, looks at the role of personal data in Dutch politics.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: The Behavioral Data Debate We Need
content: Our Executive Director Stephanie Hankey writes for Project Syndicate about how we use systems driven by big data in crises such as the coronavirus pandemic.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Smartphone as Lifeline: Designing Technology for a Changing World
content:
The global community is undergoing unprecedented political,
environmental and social changes. In this context, smartphones provide
essential access to resources, services and vital connections to friends and
family, This new research study asks: How can we design data-driven
technologies for the real world, not the ideal world?
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: The Organiser’s Activity Book
content: The Organiser’s Activity Book is a new self-learning resource from Tactical Tech’s Data and Activism project. The book is a collection of playful exercises for organisers within civil society who work with the personal data of human rights defenders, investigators, campaigners, and others who are taking part in social or political action.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Misinformation, Disinformation & Coronavirus
content:
What's the difference between misinformation and disinformation?
And how can we combat both online in the context of coronavirus? Find out in
our guest post for the Stop Funding Hate campaign.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Your Personal Data Is Political Data
content: Find out about the impact of Tactical Tech's report ‘Personal Data: Political Persuasion’, an investigation into the global 'Influence Industry' by our Data & Politics team
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Health Vs. Hoax: Immunize Yourself Against Health Misinformation Online
content: Knowing how to spot health misinformation and stop it spreading can be just as important for your own wellbeing, and for those around you, as washing your hands. These new tips from the Data Detox Kit will help boost your immunity to coronavirus hoaxes!
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: The Glass Room: Winner of Creative Review's Annual 2020
content: We are delighted to announce that The Glass Room has been selected as one of the winners of Creative Review's The Annual 2020 award. The Glass Room was described as "thought-provoking...a fascinating look at our relationship with digital devices".
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Trump’s Official 2020 Mobile App: What Campaign Apps Mean for Voter Data
content: What does the proliferation of campaign apps mean for you? How do they collect our personal data, and what challenges do such technologies pose for our democracies?
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Annual Report 2019
content:
In our Annual Report 2019, you can read about our activities and
successes across our four main projects in the last year, as well as who we
are as an organisation.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: A Data Detox Kit for Young People
content: Data Detox x Youth is an activity book to help young people take control of their tech. This interactive toolkit encourages young people to think about different aspects of their digital lives, from their social media profiles to their passwords, with simple activities for reflection and play.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: What’s in a Company?
content:
From Exposing the Invisible - The Kit: Get started with basic know-how
about researching companies by understanding essential concepts and
practices used in the ‘corporate world’, accessing useful resources to
help you map business ownership and connections, and seeing how others
investigate obscure business activities around the world.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: "Technology is Stupid": How to Choose Tech for Remote Working
content: Tactical Tech's co-founder Marek Tuszynski addresses the question of which technology is good, safe and appropriate to help us act and work responsibly and remotely during the coronavirus pandemic - and how to make answering this question easier in the future.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: La technologie est stupide : comment choisir la technologie pour le travail à distance
content: Cet article aborde les questions de savoir quelle technologie est bonne, sûre et appropriée à utiliser en ces temps complexes si nous voulons agir et travailler de manière responsable et à distance. Comment décider de la technologie à laquelle nous devons faire confiance ? Il examine également ce qui pourrait être fait à l'avenir pour répondre à cette question beaucoup plus facilement qu'aujourd'hui.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: A Small World? WhatsApp’s Big Misinformation Problem
content: Our co-founder Stephanie Hankey writes on Medium about misinformation on WhatsApp.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Ad.Watch - Investigating Political Ads on Facebook
content: From Exposing the Invisible - The Kit: Two investigators trace their process of creating the project ad.watch, an open-research-style investigation into political advertising on Facebook. This case study follows the project’s evolution from a limited endeavour to a growing resource that facilitates investigations on political ads around the world.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: As The World Goes Online, Politics is There to Meet Us
content: As the world goes online amid the coronavirus pandemic, it is no surprise that politics is moving online too. Tactical Tech’s Data and Politics Team have identified five digital campaigning trends that we’re likely to see more of in the coming weeks and months.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Digital Resources for Citizen Investigators
content: Many of us currently live and work in physical isolation, but we are constantly bombarded with digital information. Some of it is biased, some of it is fake, and some of it can cause unnecessary panic. Now is the perfect moment to polish your evidence collection and verification skills - so we've compiled a package of recommended resources for investigation-hungry citizens.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: 6 Tips to Steer Clear of Misinformation Online
content:
Misinformation circulates quickly, especially in times of crisis.
During the coronavirus pandemic, separating fact from fiction is more
important than ever. We've compiled 6 new tips to help you steer clear of
misinformation online.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Members of the Supervisory Board
content: As a Tactical Tech Board Member, you will help shape the future of the organisation by overseeing the strategy. You will help build theory to move on our mission to investigate the evolving impact of digital technologies on society, with an aim to educate, share and create practical solutions.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: ABC News Interview: Coronavirus and WhatsApp Misinformation
content:
Our co-founder and Executive Director Stephanie Hankey was
interviewed by ABC News about how coronavirus misinformation is going viral on
WhatsApp.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Signs, Symbols and Other Visual Clues
content:
From Exposing the Invisible The Kit: How to investigate or aid your investigation by exploring visual signs
or symbols, especially in cases where very little direct information is visible, available or accessible.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Design Internship
content: Tactical Tech's Products Team is looking for a Design Intern to assist with our print materials and public-facing websites. This is an ideal job for a student looking to work on highly visible projects.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Interviews: the Human Element of Your Investigation
content: From Exposing the Invisible the Kit: Gain the techniques, skills and good practices you need to safely identify, interview and maintain contact with people during your investigations in order to gather and strengthen evidence.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: How to Manage Your Sources
content: From Exposing the Invisible The Kit: Start building your own contacts, learn how to develop, interact with and maintain sources and how to enrich your investigations with their cooperation.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Away From Your Screen, Out in the Field
content: From Exposing the Invisible The Kit: As you step into the offline world, see what it takes to plan, run and evaluate your field investigation safely and effectively.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Tactical Tech's Youth Initiative
content: In 2020, Tactical Tech will embark on a new initiative that will seek to empower  young people, aged 10-18, with the skills and critical thinking they need to shape their digital futures. Put simply, children and teenagers, should have a say in what their future looks like, and as we’ve seen with the burgeoning youth environmental movement, they are ready to take matters into their own hands.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: The Glass Room San Francisco
content: Thank you to everyone who took part in The Glass Room San Francisco that ran from 16 October to 3 November 2019 with over 20,000 visitors, a daily program of events, and over 50 artworks that playfully and provocatively explore our relationship to technology.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Tactical Tech Lite is Live!
content: We're excited to launch the Lite version of this website, optimised for people whose access to connections or newer devices are limited or restrictive. The Lite site uses a sparse design, and responds directly to the browser used. It is available to any computer that has a web browser –– even devices that don't support images or JavaScript.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Partnership Opportunities with Tactical Tech’s Data & Politics Team 'Inside the Influence Industry'
content: Tactical Tech is looking to partner with like-minded organisations to outreach, translate, contextualise and co-create existing and new content around our research on digital election campaign techniques, particularly the report 'Personal Data: Political Persuasion. Inside the Influence Industry. How it works'.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Annual Report 2018
content: In 2018, we celebrated the 15 year anniversary of the organisation. In our Annual Report you can read about what we acheived in this landmark year, across all of our projects, through research, toolkits, events and collaborations, towards of our mission of investigating and mitigating the evolving impact of technology on society.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Shrinking Civil Space: A Digital Perspective
content: This paper looks at shrinking civic space in terms of the digital, in particular the role that digital technologies can have on restricting the spaces of civil society organisations and their activities.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Tactical Tech's New Look
content: In March 2019, Tactical Tech celebrated its 16 year anniversary. As well as being a time to honour the past decade and a half of work, we used it as an opportunity to review our strategy, our working environment and our visual identity. Here's a short statement about what we've done and why.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Turn On the Light: Finding the Truth on the Internet
content: A new Data Detox article looking at the tools you can use to verify information online.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Who's the Third Wheel In Your Dating Life?
content: Tinder, Grindr, Happn, OkCupid, Match, eHarmony... there are so many dating services out there. This Data Detox Bonus will introduce you to the third wheel in your dating life and give you tips on how to share less and keep more secrets.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Gendersec Training Curricula
content: A holistic and feminist perspective on privacy and digital security trainings.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Cultivating Your New Phone with Care
content: Whether you’ve gotten your new smartphone second-hand or purchased a new one, you’ve just welcomed a new device into your electronic family. As you would with any other valuable device like a computer or smart appliance, it’s not just about taking care of the outside, but making sure its insides are equipped to handle your information. The new step-by-step Data Detox guide will help you cultivate your new phone to help protect you.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Using Maps to See Beyond the Obvious
content: In this chapter from Exposing the Invisible - The Kit, Alison Killing explains how to use maps, geographic data and satellite imagery to find and visualise information for investigation.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Retrieving and Archiving Information from Websites
content: In this chapter from Exposing the Invisible - The Kit, Wael Eskandar and Brad Murray explain ways to find and retrieve historical and ‘lost’ information from websites, to serve as evidence that something existed online, and ways to archive and preserve your own copies of webpages for future reference.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Exposing the Invisible: The Kit
content: The Kit is a self-learning toolkit for investigation techniques. It's the starting point for curious minded people who want to start uncovering the evidence and information around them.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: The Dating Brokers: An Autopsy of Online Love
content: An investigation by artist Joana Moll and Tactical Tech into the data industry surrounding dating profiles.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Brazilian Elections and the Public-Private Data Trade
content:
One of 14 country studies looking at how data is used in political
processes. This report, published in partnership with Coding Rights, looks at
the private-public data trade in Brazil.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Activism on Social Media: A Curated Guide
content: There has been a lot of resources written on safer use of digital technologies and social media platforms for CSOs, grassroots groups, activists and politically-active individuals. Here we present a curated list of resources, a pool of links that can help you respond to existing risks and threats.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Geotargeting: The Political Value of Your Location
content: Our location reveals a wealth of information about us, not only about where we happen to be but also about what we are interested in, how we spend our time and what we value. This article explains what it is and how it's being used.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: India: Digital Platforms, Technologies and Data in the 2014 and 2019 Elections
content: One of 14 country studies looking at how data is used in political processes. This report, published in partnership with Elonnai Hickok, looks at the use of digital platforms and technologies in Indian elections.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Data Baggage, Travel and Activism
content: At every stage, travelling means giving away an immense amount of data that is either required by governments or by companies that provide travel-related services, or that can be automatically generated in the background. This article gives insight into the data you give away when travelling.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Online Harassment of Politically-Active Women: An Overview
content:
In this overview we analyse the challenges faced by
politically-active women who are using digital technologies to express
themselves, politically organise or carry out their work.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Machine Learning Harassment
content: Caroline Sinders explains how machine learning is already changing product design and software and how this might impact ethics and the agency of humans.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Victim blaming meets technological objectivity: Anti-rape technology and its design
content: Kate J. Sim examines how the prevailing cultural notion of sexual assault survivors as liars, and the widely held belief of technological objectivity, converge to instruct the design of anti-rape technologies.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Last Minute GDPR Checklist for Civil Society Organisations
content: The GDPR compliance explained with a last-minute checklist for civil society organisations and grassroot groups to help you check that you are handling data according to the GDPR requirements.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Digital Listening: Insights from social media
content: When you tweet your opinion about Brexit or Trump, you probably don't expect the content of your tweet to become part of an analysis of public opinion on the topic. This article explains the emerging field of digital listening and how it assess the feeling of individual potential voters and the overall public mood.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: On Weaponised Design
content: Weaponised design is a process that allows for harm of users within the defined bounds of a designed system. This article takes a look at how it can be faciliated by designers who are oblivious to the politics of digital infrastructure or consider their design practice output to be apolitical.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Efficiency and Madness
content: An essay exploring the concept of technofixes - the use of data and technology to solve social, environmental and political problems.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Quantifying Homosexuality: A Critique
content: This article examines a few moments related to the history of homosexuality and its categorisation. It starts with recent facial recognition algorithms to distinguish straight and gay faces and ends with Alan Turing’s questions about gender and The Imitation Game.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Lost in the Small Print
content: Lost in the Small Print highlights relevant information that's usually hidden in the privacy policies of the apps and services we use everyday.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Visualising Information for Advocacy: The Book
content: Visualising Information for Advocacy is a book about how advocates and activists use visual elements in their campaigns. Download the 170-page book with over 60 examples of visual information campaigns from around the world. Available in English, Spanish and Arabic.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Annual Report  2017
content: Discover our results and impact.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Gendersec Wiki
content: A website made in collaboration with the participants of the Gender and Technology Institutes to showcase activities, how-tos, storytelling and tutorials.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Holistic Security: The Trainer's Manual
content: The Trainer's Manual is the counterpart to the Holistic Security Strategy Manual for Human Rights Defenders. It reflects on further learnings and best practices grown out of Tactical Tech's engagements with experts and trainers on the overall protection, digital security, and psychosocial well-being for human rights defenders between 2013 and 2015.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Visualising Information for Advocacy: Visualising Tools
content: Whether you are trying to clean your data, spot patterns, or create a data visualisation, there are many free tools available online. This resource helps you find the one that's best suited to you.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Annual Report  2016
content: Discover our results and impact.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Zen and the Art of Making Tech Work for You
content: This manual is a community-built resource for women and trans activists, human rights defenders and technologists to help them work safely online and off. It is designed to be a living, growing collection of practical guidance, built out of the Gender and Technology Institutes.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Alternative App Centre
content: A recommended collection of open-source tools, apps and services for better privacy and control, plus a selection of guides, tutorials, and videos to help you better understand and manage your digital traces.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Visualising Information for Advocacy: Working with Data
content: A guide on how to clean, explore and understand your data, based on two courses created for The School of Data.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Trackography
content: An interactive resource which aims to increase transparency about the online data industry by illustrating who tracks us when we browse the internet.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Annual report 2015
content: Discover our results and impact.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Annual Report  2014
content: Discover our results and impact.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

title: Protect Your Device from Malware and Phishing Attacks
content: One of the 10 Security In-a-box Tactics Guides, explaining what malware and phishing attacks are, the different types, and how to prevent them on your device.
sourceDescription: Tactical Tech is an international NGO that engages with citizens and civil-society organisations to explore and mitigate the impacts of technology on society.

This announcement is an overdue but welcome acknowledgement of TikTok’s addictiv...

The newspaper explained that a 1972 law “doe...

title: Russia: The Price of ‘Treason’
content: The Kremlin-controlled TV channel Rossiya 1 aired a documentary under the dramatic title Predatelstvo (High Treason) in early February. The program’s structure was fairly simple — essentially a series of interviews with prisoners accused of “terrorist” attacks carried out on the orders of Ukrainian intelligence, paired with menacing warnings from talking heads provided by Russia’s security services. The program was broadcast shortly before the February 6 shooting of the GRU’s deputy head at his ...
creator: Andrei Soldatov

title: CC at the AI Impact Summit: Core Interventions for the Public Interest
content: This month, CC will be represented at the AI Impact Summit in Delhi , an international gathering shaping the future of AI policy and practice. The 2026 Summit follows the AI Action Summit in Paris in February 2025, where CC underscored a simple but essential truth : without civil society, there can be no public interest. Last year, our interventions focused on why civil society participation matters, the importance of openness in AI, and the need for local solutions grounded in local contexts. T...

title: Guest Post: The World Factbook is Gone
content: Today's post is by Christopher Steven Marcum, an Open Science Advocate and former senior personnel at the Office of Management and Budget. On February 4, 2026, the CIA made the surprising decision to shut down the World Factbook after more than sixty years of operation. This move was not just a simple website update. By removing the site and setting up redirects that lead away from historical data, the agency effectively broke millions of links used in schools, news reports, and scientific ...

content: The ACQuA (Approches Computationnelles et Quantitatives en Archéologie) 2026 conference takes place on February the 9th and 10th, 2026. title: European experts renew call for decisive action to preserve the Iron Gate of Antioch in Türkiye
content: On 6 February 2026, the third anniversary of the devastating earthquakes that struck southern Türkiye, the publication of the T echnical Report on the Iron Gate of Antioch by a European expert team marks both a moment of remembrance and a renewed call to action. Following a nomination made by Europa Nostra Türkiye in 2023, the Iron Gate of Antioch in Antakya / Hatay province, Türkiye, was listed among the 7 Most Endangered heritage sites in Europe in 2024 by Europa Nostra , in the frame of its 7...

Just as the Kremlin uses oil tankers flying false flags to transport Russian oil overseas, it uses false claims pushed by its foreign information manipulation and interfer...

title: Day 41 of the Protests: New Domestic and International Reactions to the Protests and the Continued Arrests
content: HRANA – According to HRANA’s latest aggregated data, by the end of the forty-first day since the start of the protests, a total of 675 protest-related incidents have been recorded across 210 cities in 31 provinces. The total number of those killed has been reported as 6,955, of whom 6,505 have been classified as “protesters.” Additionally, 175 were children under the age of 18, 214 were government forces, and 61 were reported in the category of non-protester civilian. During the same period, 11,...

title: UNRIC etsii suomenkielistä harjoittelijaa
content: Harjoittelija osallistuu täysipainoisesti tiedotuskeskuksen työhön. Aloituspäivä on milloin tahansa ja päivämäärä on neuvoteltavissa. Hakemusten määräaika on 2. Maaliskuu. title: Extreme Inequality Presages The Revolt Against It
content: When inequality is too vast to last, it doesn’t. The skyrocketing valuations of Big Tech and the staggering concentration of wealth accruing to its titans only presage a revolt against the depredations of disparity. The advent of our new Gilded Age of silicon plutocrats will be remembered as the moment when the Daoist principle of “the reverse movement of history” was set in motion. That principle holds that strengthening an ascending tendency also strengthens the opposition to it, laying the se...

title: Review Articles, Generative AI and the Remaking of Scholarly Infrastructure - Nazarovets - 2026 - Learned Publishing - Wiley Online Library
content: "Key Points GenAI exposes structural weaknesses in descriptive, template-driven review formats. arXiv and AI-native preprint platforms illustrate divergent infrastructural responses to AI-generated content. Review articles function as knowledge infrastructure, not merely as summaries of prior work. Reflexive, agenda-setting reviews remain resistant to automation and retain high editorial value. The future of review articles lies in function and interpretation, not volume or exhaustiveness."
sourceDescription:

title: Wikimedia and the new knowledge loop – report from a Wikimedia CH roundtable
content: One does not need to buy into the hype around generative AI to recognize that it is fundamentally reshaping Wikipedia. The signs are already visible, made clear by two data points from last year: An 8% drop in human traffic, a 50% surge in bot activity. AI is not just intensively reading Wikipedia — it is replacing it as the interface to knowledge. And we do not know how these trends will shape Wikipedia and the wider knowledge ecosystem. title: Democracy Dies in Broad Daylight
content: In America today, journalism still exists, but the chain that once ran from reporting to shared reality to institutional response has begun to break apart. The consequence is a democracy where truth no longer matters, because facts can be published, verified, and still fail to trigger a response.

title: The Financial Gulf Stream Is Nearing a Tipping Point

creator: Herman Rucic
sourceDescription: KR21 (Knowledge Rights 21) works to bring about changes in legislation and practice across Europe that will strengthen the right of all to access and apply knowledge for the benefit of research, science and society at large. This – and the education, knowledge valorisation and cultural participation it enables – are essential for innovation and development, and must be available to everyone in the information society, free of unnecessary hindrance or limitation. To achieve this, we believe that we need a modern legislative framework that places current research, education and scientific practice front and centre.

title: 分析：清洁能源2025年为中国GDP增长贡献超过三分之一
content: 2025年，太阳能、电动汽车及其他清洁能源技术对中国经济增长的贡献已超过三分之一，并拉动超过九成的投资增长。 中国清洁能源行业产值在2025年达到创纪录的15.4万亿元人民币（约合2.1万亿美元），约占国内生产总值（GDP）的11.4%，该数字相当于巴西或加拿大的经济规模。 Carbon Brief基于官方数字、行业数据及分析师报告进行的最新分析显示，2022年至2025年间，中国清洁能源行业的实际规模几乎翻了一番；若将其视为一个独立经济体，其规模可位列全球第八。 该分析的其他主要成果包括： 清洁能源行业支撑中国实现了“5%左右”的GDP增长目标，若排除清洁能源行业，2025年GDP实际增速仅为3.5%。 清洁能源产业的扩张速度持续快于整体经济，其年增长率从2024年的12%提升至2025年的18%。 电动汽车、电池和光伏“新三样”仍是中国清洁能源经济贡献的核心，创造了约三分之二的增加值，并吸纳了一半以上的行业投资。 2025年，中国在清洁能源领域的投资达7.2万亿元人民币（约1万亿美元），约为同期化石燃料开采与煤电投资（2600亿美元）的四倍。 尽管2025年清洁能源技术出口保持了快...
creator: Carbon Brief Staff

title: Female genital cutting: why Southeast Asia should follow Africa’s lead in challenging religious and cultural justifications
content: Illustration of campaign against Female Genital Mutilation (FGM). Tunatura/Shutterstock Female genital mutilation or cutting (FGM/C) remains a threat to the rights of women in Southeast Asia, often religiously and culturally justified. Yet, despite lasting physical and psychological impacts , governments have not mounted a coordinated regional effort to address it.
